title: We’re still celebrating that time Team USA beat the Soviets 37 years ago (11 Photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
Yesterday marked the 37th anniversary of Team USA defeating the Soviet Union during the 1980 Olympics. Yeah we’re a day late honoring this amazing victory, but we got tied up drinking margaritas and practicing our best Russian accents. We like to stay cultured at theCHIVE HQ. It doesn’t matter though because every day is the perfect day to celebrate America winning. 
I’m a huge hockey fan so looking back on that monumental win gives me all the feels. Even if hockey isn’t your sport, this epic moment in history will still make you want to break out into a spontaneous “USA!” chant. 
Let’s relive that glorious game from 37 years ago. 2 
A group of young, college hockey players took on the defending gold-medal champions during the 1980 Olympics in Lake Placid, NY. In the last minute of play, USA was able to sneak in another goal resulting in a 4-3 victory. 3 
Sports commentator, Al Michaels made the now legendary call as they scored during the last minute yelling, “Do you believe in miracles? YES!” Now this game will forever be remembered as the Miracle on Ice. 4
